description: The Critical Thinking Assessment for Literacy in Visualizations (CALVI) library is a collection of visualizations and questions designed to assess the ability to interpret data visualizations. The library includes a variety of visualizations, such as line graphs, bar charts, and pie charts, along with corresponding questions that test the user's understanding of the data presented. The questions are designed to be challenging and require critical thinking skills to answer correctly.
reference: Lily W. Ge, Yuan Cui, and Matthew Kay. 2023. CALVI: Critical Thinking Assessment for Literacy in Visualizations. In Proceedings of the 2023 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems (CHI '23). Association for Computing Machinery, New York, NY, USA, Article 815, 1â€“18.

response.prompt: What is the number of visitors at theater A as a proportion of that at theater B in 2001?
Which statement about the daily number of traffic accidents from Jan 01 to Jan 15 in state Z is true?

options.label: It was higher on Jan 08 than Jan 07.
It increased from Jan 11 to Jan 15.
All of the days had more than 25 accidents.
It decreased from Jan 03 to Jan 07.

response.prompt: Which of the following statements is true about the customers at the three bike shops in city Z?

options.label: On Jul 02, shop B had more customers than A and C combined.
The number of customers at shop C decreased from Jul 01 to Jul 03.
The number of customers at shop A increased from Jul 01 to Jul 03.

response.prompt: Which of the following is true about the advertising expense breakdown of company Z in countries A, B, and C?

options.label: Advertising expense for TV & radio was higher than that from social media in country A.
In country C, company Z had less advertising expense for direct mail than the other two methods.
Company Z had the highest total advertising expense in country B.

response.prompt: Which of the following is true about the four brands of perfume in city Z?

options.label: The market share of brand D is on an increasing trend from 2011 to 2015.
The market share of brand A is higher in 2011 than in 2012.
In 2013, brand B had the largest market share among all four brands.

response.prompt: Which of the following about the monthly number of new clients is true?

options.label: It decreased from Mar to Jun for company A.
It is higher in Feb for company B than company A.
It increased from Sep to Dec for company B.

response.prompt: What is the trend of the monthly number of new restaurant openings in county Y in 2000?
Is the total number of beers consumed by person Z in the first half of 2005 higher than that in the second half?

N9.description: Store C’s Sales vs Store B

response.prompt: Approximately, what is store C’s total sales as a proportion of store B’s total sales in 1995?
Is there a positive relationship between SAT score and annual family income for students in city Z?
Which of the following is true about the residents in towns X and Y?

options.label: There is a negative relationship between sleep quality score and average weekly hours spent outdoors for town X.
There is a positive relationship between sleep quality score and average weekly hours spent outdoors for town Y.
Most residents in town X spend more than 6 hours outdoors every week.

response.prompt: Which of the following is true about the market share of grocery stores in town Z?

options.label: Store A has less than half of the total market share.
Store C has a higher market share than store B.
Store B has the second highest market share.

response.prompt: Which of the following is true about the education level of residents in city Z?

options.label: More than 60% of residents have a Bachelor’s degree or above.
The majority of residents have a graduate degree.
There are fewer residents whose education level is Associate degree than those with a high school degree.

response.prompt: Which of the following states has the highest number of Lego owners?
Which of the following is true about Restaurant R?

options.label: It is more popular in region E than in D.
It is less popular in region A than in C.
It is more popular in region B than in C.
It is less popular in region C than in D.

options.label: More employees have vacation days at D than those at A.
More employees have a satisfaction rating at B than those who have a rating at C.

T21.description: Bar chart of rainfall over 14 days

response.prompt: Which statement about rainfall (mm) is true for the past 14 days?

options.label: The amount of rainfall peaked at the end of the past 14 days.
There was more rainfall at the beginning than at the end of the past 14 days.
None of the days had lower than 40mm of rainfall.
The amount of rainfall peaked at the beginning of the past 14 days.

All three farms planted fewer vegetables in 2022 than they did in the previous years.
All three farms planted about the same amount of vegetables in 2022 as they did in the previous years.
